Question.QuestionText: On a scale of 1 to 5 , how would you rate your confidence on being able to handle an emergency - like a health set back or sudden loss of income?
Have you faced any emergency situation in the past?
If yes, what kind of emergency?
Were you able to manage this emergency without having to borrow or sell your assets?
How many months do you think you will be able to manage without an income?
In the event of death or disability of the key earning member in your household, how sure are you that your family will be safe and comfortable? Rate on a scale of 1-5
Do you have Life Insurance?
If yes, what kind?
How much cover does your Life Insurance provide (in Rs)?
Do you have Health Insurance?
If yes, How much?
Who all in the family are covered under this Health Insurance? Please name them
Question.ControlLabel: [Use CTRL key to select multiple family members]

Question.QuestionText: Are you covered for possible critical illness?
If yes, How much?
Are you covered for possible accidents?
If yes, How much?
Are your assets like house and contents covered?
On a scale of 1 to 5 , how would you rate your confidence on being able to handle all your responsibilities and achieve all your life's dreams comfortably?
What is the Value(in Rs) of Assets you currently have?
How much MONTHLY investment do you do?
% Available to Goals
On a scale of 1 to 5, how would you rate your preparedness to lead a comfortable life of your choice after retirement?
At what age do you want to retire?
Have you assessed how much money you might need to lead a comfortable retired life?
What kind of retirement benefits does your employment provides?
How much of your expence % will continue after Retirement?
What is the Value(in Rs) of Assets you currently have for your retirement?
How much MONTHLY investment do you do for your Retirement?
On a scale of 1 to 5, how confident are you that, in the event of your death or disability your assets will be accessible AND distributed to your loved ones easily and legally?
Does your family know what all assets you have?
Will your family be able to access them easily?
Does your family know how to use the assets?
On a scale of 1 to 5, how would you rate the amount of control you have on your expenses?
How much is your average monthly expenditure?
How much is your annual household net income?
How much Monthly EMI/Commitments/Premiums do you pay against your loan?
How many sources of income do you have?
How would you rate your level of comfort with the amount of loan you have? Rate on a scale of 1-5
What kind of loans do you have?
How much is the total outstanding loan amount?
Do you plan to take any loans in future?
If yes, for what purpose?
Before making any important financial decision, what do you usually consider?

Imagine you go to a shop to buy your groceries. As you are about to pick your regular brand, the shop owner asks you to try a new brand and you pick it up. It turns out bad. Next time the shop keeper says that the last lot was not good, the new lot is a lot better and the product has been improved and tested. What are you more likely to do?

Options.Option: Most likely give it a skip

Question.QuestionText: How would you describe your knowledge of investments, markets, products?
What is your primary objective while making an investment likely to be?

Options.Option: To create a regular stream of income

Question.QuestionText: If you had to choose between two jobs a) That has a huge fixed component and a small variable component b) A small fixed component and a huge variable component, which one are you most likely to choose
How easily do you usually move on if a financial decision went wrong?
Insurance is a good way to protect against different risks like early death, health related expenses or disabilities. How much of insurance do you have?

Options.Option: I have reasonable insurance to cover most risks
I have insurance to cover almost every conceivable risk

Question.QuestionText: With investments usually, to earn some higher returns you will have to assume a higher level of risk and volatility in the value of investments. Given this knowledge what kind of investments are you likely to make.

Options.Option: Take extra risk and earn some quick high returns
Will keep some basic money safe and take risk with the rest of the money
Keep most of the money safe, and take risk with a little money to earn extra returns
